image.altText: Robert with visitors 1

items.synopsis: Robert Taylor has lived in Australia since he was a baby but is facing deportation after being convicted for aggravated burglary. There are calls for him to be allowed to die with his family beside him.

title.children: Terminally ill man facing deportation after criminal conviction pleads to spend his last days at home

image.altText: Young women followers of Charles Manson

items.synopsis: Leslie Van Houten entered prison as a fresh-faced 19-year-old, devoted to notorious cult leader Charles Manson. This week the 73-year-old walked free.

title.children: Brainwashed and tripping on LSD, she took part in America’s most infamous murders. Now she’s free

image.altText: light beams filter through sea water as seaweed reaches upwards, fish swim through

items.synopsis: Groundbreaking new research shows the climate benefits of protecting and restoring underwater kelp forests could be equivalent to planting a billion trees.

title.children: The underwater 'Amazon' off Australia's coast that could help tackle climate change

image.altText: A graphic with egg labels over a carton of eggs.

items.synopsis: States and territories have agreed to phase out "conventional cages" in egg production by 2036. Could this make it easier to buy eggs from happy hens?

title.children: 'Cage eggs' are on the way out in Australia, but what does that really mean for hens and consumers?

image.altText: A young man stares straight at the camera with a blank expression on his face.

items.synopsis: Moving from a remote town with a high youth crime rate to a cattle station changed Quentin Skeen's life and he wants more young people to have the same opportunity.

title.children: 'I'd be in jail right now': How life on the land changed Quentin's future

image.altText: A young woman is silhouetted by a window, wearing a cap and hugging herself.

items.synopsis: New research finds a direct causal relationship between unemployment and suicide, suggesting implications for public policy, writes Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Unemployment has caused suicide in Australia, new research finds

image.altText: A view from above of extensive flooding over fields

items.synopsis: From blistering heatwaves in southern Europe and Asia to month-long floods in California, extreme weather has swept the world this year — and climate scientists warn it may be just a taste of what's to come.

title.children: Extreme weather has lashed the world already this year — and it could be just the start

image.altText: Jai Hindley looks pained as he rides

items.synopsis: Australian Jai Hindley loses his place on the Tour de France podium after an early crash in the 14th stage costs him precious time and leaves him with a literal "pain in the arse".

title.children: Mass crash gives Jai Hindley a literal 'pain in the arse' as he drops off TDF podium

image.altText: A group photo of Cameron Caldwell with supporters cheering

items.synopsis: The win in the LNP safe seat comes after two bruising losses for the Coalition, April's Aston by-election and last May's federal election.

title.children: LNP and Labor hone message after Caldwell wins by-election for Opposition

image.altText: Homeless Geelong man Les in bed

items.synopsis: Homelessness is growing three times as quickly in regional Victoria as it is in Melbourne, with support services being forced to turn away people in need.

title.children: Les sleeps in a crawl space every night on the edge of Geelong's CBD. He's a sign of the times in regional Victoria

image.altText: Beautiful cloud cover over Lake Machattie in the Channel Country

items.synopsis: Heading north, deep purples, reds and browns blend through what's known as the Channel Country, more than 200,000 square kilometres of arid landscape and ancient flood plains.

title.children: A once stark desert landscape now awash with a kaleidoscope of colours

image.altText: Marketa Vondrousova holds up a plate-shaped golden trophy and smiles

items.synopsis: Twenty-four-year-old Marketa Vondrousa defeats Ons Jabeur in straight sets to become the first unseeded player to win the Wimbledon women's singles title in the professional era.

title.children: Vondrousova shocks Jabeur to become lowest ranked women's Wimbledon winner in history

image.altText: J. Robert Oppenheimer (L) is portrayed by Cillian Murphy (R) in Christopher Nolan's upcoming biopic.

items.synopsis: Director Christopher Nolan is renowned for his massive, cinema-filling films and he's taking his obsession to the maximum with Oppenheimer.

title.children: What is the movie Oppenheimer about and do you really have to see it on 70mm film?

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile poking its head out of a body of water.

items.synopsis: According to a crocodile expert, it's "very normal" for saltwater crocodiles to end up in freshwater swimming holes. This is how, and why, they got there.

title.children: Why have saltwater crocs been appearing in the NT's freshwater swimming holes?

image.altText: A young woman stands outside holding two children: a little boy with a green toy and a toddler in pink shirt

items.synopsis: Just across a dry riverbed from the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant lies the Ukrainian town of Nikopol. Despite the Kakhovka dam attack cutting off their water supply and constant shelling from Russia, they say they won't be driven away.

title.children: In Russia's crosshairs, with no water and the threat of nuclear sabotage, life in Nikopol is grim

image.altText: Raidah is shown wearing a light blue hijab, with an orange background behind her.

items.synopsis: Five years ago, Raidah approached her brother with an unusual idea. She wanted to bond their families through an ancient practice that carries implications under Islamic law.

title.children: Muslim 'milk mums' are not common. But for Raidah, it’s created a special bond with her nephew

items.synopsis: More than 800 covers were cut down to your 100 favourites, and we've dug into all the stats.

title.children: Missed the Hottest 100 of Like A Version? Here’s what you need to know

image.altText: An illustration by Arthur Rackham of Alice in Wonderland, a girl holding up her arms at playing cards

items.synopsis: Canberra's Lifeline book fair has become a haunt for book lovers, with rare first editions among the gems up for auction, and all proceeds going to those in need of mental health support.

title.children: Rare Lewis Carroll classic among treasures up for auction at Lifeline book fair

image.altText: Women in a hospital setting wearing bright coloured dressing as one woman nurses a baby

items.synopsis: Repurposed medical supplies from Queensland hospitals are improving health services for rural Papua New Guineans, who volunteers say have been left behind by their government.

title.children: One Queensland hospital has saved $580,000 and changed lives in PNG through recycling

image.altText: A Southern Cross Windmill silhouetted against a yellow and orange sunset

items.synopsis: Heart of Australia founder Rolf Gomes is living proof specialists can be city-based and still treat rural patients. Now, he is showing medical students the ropes in mobile healthcare and encouraging them to follow his lead.

title.children: Could more city doctors doing a stint in mobile clinics help solve rural Australia's health crisis?

image.altText: Reclink (1)

items.synopsis: From Melbourne to Brisbane and Hobart to Fremantle, musicians and media gather every year to kick a footy for a cause — and it was all started on the streets of St Kilda.

title.children: Prime ministers, popes and Paul Kelly — how a kick-to-kick 30 years ago led to a national footy phenomenon

image.altText: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol shakes hands with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

items.synopsis: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol makes a surprise visit to Ukraine, offering support for the invaded country in its war with Russia.

title.children: South Korean President Yoon likens Ukraine conflict to Korean War in surprise visit

image.altText: a man at a construction site where a house is being built

items.synopsis: About 100 projects were submitted by developers to the Rezoning Pathways Pilot— a controversial scheme initiated by the former state government.

title.children: NSW government reveals five suburbs where thousands of homes will be fast-tracked

image.altText: A composite image of a woman sitting down smiling and smiling on the beach

items.synopsis: You only need to get a screening for breast cancer when you're older, right? We break down everything to do with mammograms and with the help of these experts, bust some myths about them.

title.children: Are mammograms for older women? Jess was 27 when she was diagnosed with breast cancer

image.altText: Cars wait in bumper to bumper morning traffic on a busy road

items.synopsis: Australians love big cars, and it's undoing the good work of the shift to more electric and hybrid vehicles.

title.children: Australia is obsessed with big cars, and it’s a problem

image.altText: The booking image of Rex Heuermann. He is a middle-aged white man, with short brown hair, blue eyes and a wide square jaw.

items.synopsis: An architect has been charged with the murder of three out of 11 victims in the long-unsolved Gilgo Beach murders, after US detectives matched DNA from a pizza he ate to genetic material found on the women's remains.

title.children: Suspected Long Island serial killer arrested in decade-old mystery case

image.altText: A photo of Lisa Marie Presley at an award ceremony. She's got long brown hair, blue eyes, and she's wearing a glittery dress.

items.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley died after developing a small bowel obstruction — a severe complication of bariatric surgery years ago — according to the autopsy report. Experts say these types of complications are a known but rare risk.

title.children: How Lisa Marie Presley's weight loss surgery contributed to her death

image.altText: Budapest pride march

items.synopsis: Thousands of Hungarians brave scorching heat for the annual Pride march in Budapest, protesting against government controls over public displays by the LGBT community.

title.children: Thousands join Budapest Pride in protest at Hungary's anti-LGBT moves

image.altText: Three Wallabies players look dejected during a Test match against the Pumas.

items.synopsis: A try in the shadows of full-time gives the Michael Cheika-coached Argentina a 34-31 victory, consigning Eddie Jones's Wallabies to a second consecutive defeat in The Rugby Championship.

title.children: Wallabies slump to another loss as Cheika’s Pumas triumph in dramatic finish

image.altText: Matildas Active Support fans bang a drum in the stands during a game at Suncorp Stadium.

items.synopsis: Matildas Active Support was born during the last Women's World Cup. They're hoping more members come on board with the event on home turf this year.

title.children: Meet the Matildas supporter group creating a safe space for fans of women's sport
